t: John 7
The Unbelief of Jesus’s Brothers
After*p this, Jesus traveled in Galilee, since he did not want to travel in Judea because the Jews were trying to kill him.
The Jewish Festival of Shelters was near.
So his brothers said to him, “Leave here and go to Judea so that your disciples can see your works that you are doing.
For no one does anything in secret while he’s seeking public recognition. If you do these things, show yourself to the world.”
(For not even his brothers believed in him.)
Jesus*p told them, “My*r time*r has*r not*r yet*r arrived,*r but*r your*r time*r is*r always*r at*r hand.*r
The*r world*r cannot*r hate*r you,*r but*r it*r does*r hate*r me*r because*r I*r testify*r about*r it — that*r its*r works*r are*r evil.*r
Go*r up*r to*r the*r festival*r yourselves.*r I’m*r not*r going*r up*r to*r this*r festival,*r because*r my*r time*r has*r not*r yet*r fully*r come.”*r
After he had said these things, he stayed in Galilee.
Jesus at the Festival of Shelters
After*p his brothers had gone up to the festival, then he also went up, not openly but secretly.
The Jews were looking for him at the festival and saying, “Where is he?”
And there was a lot of murmuring about him among the crowds. Some were saying, “He’s a good man.” Others were saying, “No, on the contrary, he’s deceiving the people.”
Still, nobody was talking publicly about him for fear of the Jews.
When*p the festival was already half over, Jesus went up into the temple and began to teach.
Then the Jews were amazed and said, “How is this man so learned, since he hasn’t been trained?”
Jesus*p answered them, “My*r teaching*r isn’t*r mine*r but*r is*r from*r the*r one*r who*r sent*r me.*r
If*r anyone*r wants*r to*r do*r his*r will,*r he*r will*r know*r whether*r the*r teaching*r is*r from*r God*r or*r whether*r I*r am*r speaking*r on*r my*r own.*r

The*r one*r who*r speaks*r on*r his*r own*r seeks*r his*r own*r glory;*r but*r he*r who*r seeks*r the*r glory*r of*r the*r one*r who*r sent*r him*r is*r true,*r and*r there*r is*r no*r unrighteousness*r in*r him.*r
Didn’t*r Moses*r give*r you*r the*r law?*r Yet*r none*r of*r you*r keeps*r the*r law.*r Why*r are*r you*r trying*r to*r kill*r me?”*r
“You*p have a demon!” the crowd responded. “Who is trying to kill you?”
“I*rp performed*r one*r work,*r and*r you*r are*r all*r amazed,”*r Jesus answered.
“This*r is*r why*r Moses*r has*r given*r you*r circumcision*r — not*r that*r it*r comes*r from*r Moses*r but*r from*r the*r fathers*r — and*r you*r circumcise*r a*r man*r on*r the*r Sabbath.*r

If*r a*r man*r receives*r circumcision*r on*r the*r Sabbath*r so*r that*r the*r law*r of*r Moses*r won’t*r be*r broken,*r are*r you*r angry*r at*r me*r because*r I*r made*r a*r man*r entirely*r well*r on*r the*r Sabbath?*r
Stop*r judging*r according*r to*r outward*r appearances;*r rather*r judge*r according*r to*r righteous*r judgment.”*r
The Identity of the Messiah
Some*p of the people of Jerusalem were saying, “Isn’t this the man they are trying to kill?
Yet, look, he’s speaking publicly and they’re saying nothing to him. Can it be true that the authorities know he is the Messiah?
But we know where this man is from. When the Messiah comes, nobody will know where he is from.”

As*p he was teaching in the temple, Jesus cried out, “You*r know*r me*r and*r you*r know*r where*r I*r am*r from.*r Yet*r I*r have*r not*r come*r on*r my*r own,*r but*r the*r one*r who*r sent*r me*r is*r true.*r You*r don’t*r know*r him;*r
I*r know*r him*r because*r I*r am*r from*r him,*r and*r he*r sent*r me.”*r
Then*p they tried to seize him. Yet no one laid a hand on him because his hour had not yet come.
However, many from the crowd believed in him and said, “When the Messiah comes, he won’t perform more signs than this man has done, will he?”
The Pharisees heard the crowd murmuring these things about him, and so the chief priests and the Pharisees sent servants to arrest him.
Then*p Jesus said, “I*r am*r only*r with*r you*r for*r a*r short*r time.*r Then*r I’m*r going*r to*r the*r one*r who*r sent*r me.*r
You*r will*r look*r for*r me,*r but*r you*r will*r not*r find*r me;*r and*r where*r I*r am,*r you*r cannot*r come.”*r
Then*p the Jews said to one another, “Where does he intend to go that we won’t find him? He doesn’t intend to go to the Jewish people dispersed among the Greeks and teach the Greeks, does he?
What is this remark he made: ‘You*r will*r look*r for*r me,*r and*r you*r will*r not*r find*r me;*r and*r where*r I*r am,*r you*r cannot*r come’?”*r
The Promise of the Spirit
On*p the last and most important day of the festival, Jesus stood up and cried out, “If*r anyone*r is*r thirsty,*r let*r him*r come*r to*r me*r and*r drink.*r
The*r one*r who*r believes*r in*r me,*r as*r the*r Scripture*r has*r said,*r will*r have*r streams*r of*r living*r water*r flow*r from*r deep*r within*r him.”*r
He said this about the Spirit. Those who believed in Jesus were going to receive the Spirit, for the Spirit had not yet been given because Jesus had not yet been glorified.
The People Are Divided over Jesus
When*p some from the crowd heard these words, they said, “This truly is the Prophet.”
Others said, “This is the Messiah.” But some said, “Surely the Messiah doesn’t come from Galilee, does he?
Doesn’t the Scripture say that the Messiah comes from David’s offspring and from the town of Bethlehem, where David lived?”
So the crowd was divided because of him.
Some of them wanted to seize him, but no one laid hands on him.
Debate over Jesus’s Claims
Then*p the servants came to the chief priests and Pharisees, who asked them, “Why didn’t you bring him?”
The*p servants answered, “No man ever spoke like this!”
Then*p the Pharisees responded to them, “Are you fooled too?
Have any of the rulers or Pharisees believed in him?
But this crowd, which doesn’t know the law, is accursed.”
Nicodemus*p — the one who came to him previously and who was one of them — said to them,
“Our law doesn’t judge a man before it hears from him and knows what he’s doing, does it?”
“You*p aren’t from Galilee too, are you?” they replied. “Investigate and you will see that no prophet arises from Galilee.” [The*pc earliest mss do not include 7:53–8:11.] [*p
Then each one went to his house.
